text: In the recordings collected on “Joni Mitchell Archives—Vol. 1: The Early Years (1963-1967),” listeners can sense Mitchell feeling into the corners of her talent, poking and stretching it. https://t.co/23OG9yYLhN

text: Fiona Apple describes the feeling of finding the right lyrics for a song as having the words “glide down the back of my throat." She writes the alphabet above her drafts, searching, with puzzle-solver focus, for puns, rhymes, and accidental insights. https://t.co/xZmfXKkolA

text: In his own life, William Faulkner failed to truly acknowledge the evils of slavery and segregation. But he did so with savage thoroughness in his fiction. https://t.co/3REKTJiSu2

name: NewYorker
text: Mark Ellison has spent his life building other people’s dream homes, sometimes working on projects worth $50 million or more, but has never felt the desire to own any of those houses. In fact, he’d much rather live in a firehouse. https://t.co/RtEzKnuJRT

text: “These days, I’m looking at most babies and feeling nothing at all.” https://t.co/RD28WnKoYA

text: Toby Ord, a philosopher who studies our species’ collective fate, considers both the grim futures that await us if existential threats to humanity aren’t addressed and the far more promising outcomes that become possible if they are. https://t.co/UbXQqwqJG8

text: David Dinkins, New York’s first Black mayor, died last month. “He understood this city,” his former special assistant said. “He told me he wanted to work for the city as a whole, to be a voice for the unheard.” https://t.co/AfzFY9fwuo

text: Tribal activists have described COVID-19 as an “existential threat” to the indigenous peoples of the Amazon—one with a disturbing resemblance to the wave of infectious disease that decimated the people of the Americas when European settlers first arrived. https://t.co/HRHwo3Yyvt

text:

name: NewYorker
text: “Although it has disproportionately hit some communities more than others,” Ayanna Pressley says, of the pandemic, “the hurt has been felt by everyone, and so the relief must be felt by everyone.” Listen to Pressley discuss the latest COVID relief bill. https://t.co/7wUnuf1vwN

name: NewYorker
text: As the awful year of 2020 draws to a close, at least one small group of people will look back on it as a very prosperous one: America’s billionaires. https://t.co/raK5W1jSiV
